com.mapgroup.client

Class TreeClient.MyTableModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.table.AbstractTableModel
      • com.mapgroup.client.TreeClient.MyTableModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.table.TableModel
    Enclosing class:
    TreeClient

     class TreeClient.MyTableModel
extends javax.swing.table.AbstractTableModel
    This class represents a model for the table adopted to represent all the attributes for a specific dataset and their values.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      the table's column names
      private java.lang.Object[][] data
      the matrix which collects all the values

    • Method Detail

      • clearModel

        public void clearModel()
        Removes all the values contained in the model

      • getColumnClass

        public java.lang.Class getColumnClass(int c)
        Returns the Class object for the value contained in the first row of the table in the specified column.

        JTable uses this method to determine the default renderer/ editor for each cell. If we didn't implement this method, then the last column would contain text ("true"/"false"), rather than a check box.

        Specified by:
        getColumnClass in interface javax.swing.table.TableModel
        Overrides:
        getColumnClass in class javax.swing.table.AbstractTableModel
        Parameters:
        c - column index
        Returns:
        the class object of the selected value

      • getColumnCount

        public int getColumnCount()
        Returns the number of column of the table
        Returns:
        table's number of column

      • getColumnName

        public java.lang.String getColumnName(int col)
        Returns the column's name at the specified position.
        Specified by:
        getColumnName in interface javax.swing.table.TableModel
        Overrides:
        getColumnName in class javax.swing.table.AbstractTableModel
        Parameters:
        col - column's position
        Returns:
        the name of the column selected

      • getRowCount

        public int getRowCount()
        Returns the table's number of row, which represents the number of entries that are present in the table.
        Returns:
        table's number of row

      • getValueAt

        public java.lang.Object getValueAt(int row,
                          int col)
        Returns the value contained in the table's cell represented by the specified position.
        Parameters:
        row - row index of the table
        col - column index of the table
        Returns:
        value contained in the position (row, col)

      • initTableModel

        public void initTableModel()
        Initializes the table model with the values retrieved from the attrValues data structure which contains all the information about the attributes

      • isCellEditable

        public boolean isCellEditable(int row,
                     int col)
        Defines the rules in order to modify the table.

        In this context only the column in which there are the values is editable.

        Specified by:
        isCellEditable in interface javax.swing.table.TableModel
        Overrides:
        isCellEditable in class javax.swing.table.AbstractTableModel
        Parameters:
        row - row index
        col - column index
        Returns:
        true if the selected column is the second one, false otherwise

      • setValueAt

        public void setValueAt(java.lang.Object value,
              int row,
              int col)
        Changes the value in the position of the table defined by the specified indexes with the specified value.
        Specified by:

        Overrides:
        setValueAt in class javax.swing.table.AbstractTableModel
        Parameters:
        value - the new values for the table's cell
        row - row index of the cell
        col - column index of the cell
